website_summaries.verdict: A premium sandwich decruster and sealer that children won't quickly outgrow. A must for no-crust aficionados.
pros: Cuts and seals sandwiches, pastries, and tarts
Great for homemade uncrustables, with no limit on filling combinations
Quality stainless steel construction is durable and will serve owners for as long as crustless sandwiches are needed and beyond
cons: Dry, coarse breads might not seal as well

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of buying boxes of uncrustables for my kids, but they love them and and they’re so convenient. This works great. I make them with Publix premium honey wheat bread and they seal perfectly. I’ve tried a couple other types of bread that don’t work as well. Also Walmart sells square snack size bags and these fit perfectly inside.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Received used product with no Pampered Chef box/instructions and food stuck to it
customer_reviews.text: Received this USED product balled up in a bag with no box, no instructions, and food still stuck to it! Absolutely disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: N. Voges

customer_reviews.title: Great for uncrustables!
customer_reviews.text: My son is obsessed with uncrustables. I hated paying $4 for a box of peanut butter and jellies. It didn't matter if I cut the crust off, circle shapes, triangles, squares, he would always say he wanted the cold circle sandwich. This cutter was a life saver. I make about 4 or 5 at a time and freeze them and my son loves it. A tip though, if you have trouble with them coming out perfect, just try a different kind of bread. My first few were very sloppy looking and it was because it was really thin sliced bread.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron and Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great for school and work lunches!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! My husband and kids love picking the topping in their uncrustable!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Save $$ on your home made sandwiches and more !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. We use it to make that peanut butter and jelly sandwich with no crust on it for the Grand kids. We make 21 out of a loaf of bread - and so far we get over 3 loaves to a jar of peanut butter and jelly. Plus we do not add any chemicals. Of course we use them to make meat sandwiches and other things. We had one of these when we got married in 76, but had to get another one this year.Excellent Brand, Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.author: TOMMY B

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully to make "uncrustables" PB&J sandwiches. I've had best results using bread that is very "squishy" (highly technical term). A drier or more firm loaf tends to break a part rather than mash down, although flattening that type of bread with a rolling pin first does help with that a bit. Still, I find it easier to just use the squishy bread (I use Auntie Millie's 100% Whole Wheat). My five year old gives it two sticky thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: bettymae

customer_reviews.title: I made a whole loaf of bread and put them in the freezer and they work great! My kid loves them and I love the ...
customer_reviews.text: Based on some of the reviews, I was worried this wouldn't work properly. I make sure to use a small amount of peanut butter and jelly (like the name brand product uses) and have had zero issues. I made a whole loaf of bread and put them in the freezer and they work great! My kid loves them and I love the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Angela G.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for any small sandwhich
customer_reviews.text: Save your money buying uncrustables from the store and get this! Works perfect for any small sandwhich! Make my son pb&js and turkey and cheese sandwhiches! No more cutting off crusts! My mom had one when I was growing up so I know it lasts for years! Worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Finally my son can have peanut free uncrustables!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget! I am finally able to make my son his own peanut free uncrustables using Sunbutter and Honey! They look just like the store bought sandwiches too! I am able to quickly make a bunch and freeze them for my kiddos week of lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Shaul

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them at the store... Lol
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to save some money. Lol. Honestly they never seal right and you waste so much bread. And you can only put a TINY bit of P&J on the bread. Don't waste your money. Just make a whole sandwich in a zip lock. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it twice since I got it and I love it! I used it to cut the bread first, then I put the peanut butter and jelly on and then used it to seal it. They came out perfect! Kids are so excited since they aren’t allowed to have peanut butter at their school now I can make them with wowbutter!
customer_reviews.author: col

customer_reviews.title: How to work it
customer_reviews.text: I wish it came with directions! It just came in the package and I’ve had to read a lot of reviews and several sandwiches later to figure it out... my sandwiches still seem super flat but it’s a work in progress. Peanut butter on both sides of bread Jelly in the middle Use a plate to flatten sandwich Push bottom part of gadget to hit the counter so that it can cut the crush off Push the middle knob to make the crust marks Flip over and add marks to the other side Enjoy the crust for yourself :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BOTH Broke right away
customer_reviews.text: Update: second one had broken the exact same way after only a handful of sandwiches, this thing is junk! (Not shocking, its something from a multi level marketing company) Broke after making a whole 6 sandwiches. The round handle broke free of the middle rod. A replacement is on its way. If this is just a lemon I’ll update my review with the new one. It’s a bit hard to push down if you have any sort of arthritis in your hands. But it’s so nice to not have to pay for overpriced uncrustables anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Melliebeanie

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: The kids love uncrustables.. The problem is they are pretty expensive for what they are. This thing has worked well to makes hundreds of them so far and it's holding up very well. The stainless steel design means it should last forever. We make a bunch and then freeze them in the plastic snack bags. There is a trick to making them..Use FRESH bread! If the loaf of bread has been sitting a few days and is somewhat dry, the sandwich won't come out well.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I make pbj sandwiches, then freeze them in a single layer on a parchment paper lined cookie sheet. When frozen, transfer to a gallon ziplock. Perfect for school lunches, picnics, etc. I find it works best with a soft bread. I like to use whole wheat Sara Lee bread or wheat H-E-B no crust bread. I save the scraps for bread pudding.
customer_reviews.author: Kristel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted!!!
customer_reviews.text: So, I generally hop to the 1 star reviews to see what issues people have had with a product before i commit to it. The reviews here almost scared me away but being that people posted pics, its pampered chef and only $10 I decided to take a chance. I came to the conclusion that as long as you can read this product is amazing. First try i had a perfect sandwich. First time I cleaned it AND dried IT ASAP no rust. Please don't let the poor reviews by people that clearly did not read the inster deter you.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Ann

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to make homemade “uncrustables” this did not work ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make homemade “uncrustables” this did not work. The seal around the edges doesn’t seal all the way.
customer_reviews.author: TJHamrick

customer_reviews.title: It works, but its picky
customer_reviews.text: For what this costs, you would think it would cut better, honestly, I used soft bread, a thin layer of PB and J then cut. I pressed down hard a few times, and it does not cut all the way through. You still have to pull at the edges to get it off. I would not purchase again. Premise wise, it sounds great, but its more trouble and messier than it is worth Im afraid. Even after making sure I did not overfill them. Product does seem sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Graves

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Only gave those 2 stars because every time I’ve tried to use it, it doesn’t cut through the bread & I have to use a knife and trace the outside of this device to free the “crust”. It’s tricky to clean, as food gets stuck in little crevices. Mine keeps jamming on me (no pun intended lol) and I have to wiggle it a few times to release push down knob. After reading some reviews, I’ll give it a few more tries with different breads and see if that helps with the first issue of not quite cutting the crust off.
customer_reviews.author: christina rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great for homemade uncrustables for picky kids
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for home made uncrustables! The cutter does its advertised job, and easily seals and cuts the sandwiches. I followed other reviewer's advice and used thin sliced bread, flattening it with a cutting board before putting on a thin layer of PB and a small spoonful of jam. No leakage so far, no bread ripping, just yummy, easy crust free sandwiches. I plan to make a dozen of these once a week and freeze for kids lunchboxes throughout the week.
customer_reviews.author: OutNumbered

customer_reviews.title: Great for homemade Uncrustables!
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this to make homemade Uncrustable sandwiches for my kindergarten daughter. It works great if you put a little bit of peanut butter/sun butter on each piece of break and then put the jelly in the middle. When I first used it, I noticed some gray marks on the bread from the metal being new and unwashed; this went away after 3-4 sandwiches. I just wipe mine out with a paper towel after each use so far. If you are careful about not making your smear of peanut butter too large, this doesn’t really get dirty-just need to wipe out the crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: APaulsonTop Contributor: Children's Books

customer_reviews.title: Makes great little crustless sandwiches... And pies.
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well. I found it is best to push the outside edges down and twist to cut the bread first and then push down the center piece to crimp. It also comes out best if you flatten the sandwich with your hand before using this on it. I made some mini blueberry pies using refrigerated pie crust and canned filling. Came out great in my air fryer. Perfect snack size pies
customer_reviews.author: kpgile

customer_reviews.title: Read this first for a perfect sandwich!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing if you use it the ‘right’ way. I followed the instructions that it comes with... two issues: If you overfill the sandwich it will rip the bread or if the bread is too soft it gets stuck in the edging press. Best way to solve this: make your sandwiches then place a layer of plastic wrap in between the bread and the maker. Press down and voila, perfect sandwiches every time. I make about 20 at once and freeze them. Awesome kids lunch meal prep. Would definitely recommend but only after sharing the plastic wrap trick.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany E.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect smuckers sandwich maker
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I got this! My daughter loves PB&J without these crust and remember growing up eating smuckers uncrustables. It is very easy to use, simply push down on the base and the perfect circle cuts off all the crust. I use Walmart’s sandwich bread because it is large enough to where you cutout a perfect circle. Once you get the shape, push down on press to seal the sides, flip it and get the other side. When cleaning, I hand wash and immediately dry after to prevent rust. I paid $17 for the item, a little pricey in my opinion but definitely glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Motley

customer_reviews.title: WOrks and is a nice thing for picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my son was wasting half the sandwich peeling the crusts off. Didn't realize how small it was, so it still wastes a good chunk of the bread but he's able to make his own uncrustable with it so I'm ok with that. THe only thing I'm not a fan of is it's hard to clean and can't go in the dishwasher. Had I know it couldn't go in the dishwasher I wouldn't have paid the price I did for it. Especially since I found one 2 days later at Goodwill for less than $2. Sturdy and good quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but too small
customer_reviews.text: Attached are photos of my first attempt with French white bread and just a touch over 1 TBSP filling. I think I made the mistake of not flattening the sandwich before cutting. The manual indicates to use just about 1 TBSP so if you’re making PBJ, you’ll only get approx 1.5g protein in there assuming 1/2TBSP peanut butter. There is a lot of waste with this 3.5 circle so I will be trying the rectangular one by SavoyChef and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: CleverPenName

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: I chose to purchase this version over the more simple plastic one. I’m not really a fan. The cutter rarely cuts through my bottom bread. The part you push down to seal the edges gets stuck and is incredibly hard to push down. THEN, my Top bread gets stuck to it and comes up and stays inside the circle when I lift it off. Just a complicated mess. I would go with the plastic one
customer_reviews.author: Liana

customer_reviews.title: A great tool for making lunches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my son loves peanut butter and honey sandwiches and his lunchbox ends up sticky. I received this around 10 am yesterday and I have made a TON of sandwiches already! So far they seal perfectly and I just wipe clean with a damp paper towel and then dry it thoroughly. This is a total game changer for us!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie S.

customer_reviews.title: Small learning curve but worth it
customer_reviews.text: It took a few try’s to figure out the right ratio of filling so that it won’t explode but I finally got it right and we love it! I also did find that the bread has to be pretty fresh and soft so that it won’t tear while being pressed. I first tried it with a loaf that was due to expire soon and it kept cracking. Then I tried it with a soft fresh loaf and it worked like a dream
customer_reviews.author: angeledelacruz

customer_reviews.title: Saves money compared to uncrustables. Must with a toddler
customer_reviews.text: We got this to be able to take trips with our toddler and provide him with some meals while out and about. He had enjoyed the uncrustables, but they’re kinda pricy at a little more than $1 each. This allows me to control the ingredients used. We make them large batches at a time and freeze them. Only complaint is having difficulty finding what to do with all the byproduct bread that gets cut off when doing this.
customer_reviews.author: == true;

customer_reviews.title: Works! I always felt guilty buying the frozen ones!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to use if you follow the directions! Use the palm of your hand to create a little impression on the bread and put a table spoon of peanut butter and about a tablespoon of jelly. I used honey instead of jelly and used raisin bread. The bread needs to be soft. You can also dab a little warm water (a few drops) around the filling, before you top it with the other slice of bread. It’ll help make the bread stick when you press it. You’ve gotta cut the circle out first (press the base down and twist like a cookie cutter) THEN you can press down the button to seal and crimp it! It’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Kate K

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these after seeing how well it worked for my friend, but it didn’t work for us. Not only did it not completely cinch in the sides, but the pressure punched a hole in the center, allowing jelly to ooze out. Not sure if it’s only intended for certain types of bread, but it isn’t as fabulous as I hoped it would be.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Not quite Uncrustables
customer_reviews.text: My kids love uncrustables but I hate the price! I bought this in hope of saving a little money. Once I rolled the bread, they were a little better. I think I also put yoo much filling which cases the to explode. However, this tool makes an amazing seal. It is also very easy to clean. All-in-all, this is a nifty tool to have!
customer_reviews.author: TeacherMom

customer_reviews.title: Homemade Crustables
customer_reviews.text: This is THE item for making your own Crustables. It operates best with a certain type of bread. I find that breads with whole grains are better than white or wheat breads. Just make them the night before, pop in the freezer, and put in lunch the next day. Take control of your lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Nitz

customer_reviews.title: Saves me so much money!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love uncrustables, and I love them too because they're a quick snack. I was getting tired of spending so much money on buying them at the store, and wanted to be able to control the ingredients being put into them. This works best with soft bread - I roll it out a little, put in the filling, twist to cut through the bread, then seal the bread. I can easily make a dozen in 20 minutes. I keep them in the freezer to make them last longer. My husband made one with pizza filling and toasted it on the stove - yummy!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Johns

customer_reviews.title: Love using this.
customer_reviews.text: My Celiac son can't have regular uncrustables because of the gluten and I was cutting the crust off of his sandwiches at home until I discovered this nifty little device. Now my son gets gluten-free uncrustables with whatever jelly and butter combo he wants (the other day it was watermelon jelly and cinnamon almond butter). It is very easy to use, easy to take apart and completely wipe down and I love using it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Holland

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love that I can save money by making the kids their loved “uncrustable” sandwiches. They have fun making them too. We premake a couple weeks worth, wrap them and freeze. I feel like the sturdiness is lacking just a bit, so we are just careful when pressing the seal portion of the cutter... but so far I have gotten well over my money’s worth and would purchase again if that day comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jinger360

customer_reviews.title: Buy directly from PC
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Feb 2020 Too small done part broke. Reached out to Pampered chef and they do not authorize this seller. They will not stand behind this product if you buy it here. Works great. Few tips: Cheap bread works better. Squish it with your hands. Push on one side, flip sand which and do it again. Treat it like a cookie cutter and ‘slide’ it on a cutting board to separate sand which from crust.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. I tried to use it with sprouted bread but it works best with regular type sliced bread. It takes a little practice, but once you get the hang of it you get perfectly filled and sealed uncrustables. Every week, I make peanut butter and jelly as well as Nutella uncrustables and freeze them. Save money and they come out better than store bought since you can fill them up a little more and get creative with the fillings.
customer_reviews.author: Yamile Rey

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sons that LOVE uncrustables. This was hard to use and a waste of time. No instructions came with the product so it was a lot of just working with it to figure it out. The product itself was stiff to work with and hard to use. The outcome of using it was half done as some bread was too thick, others too thin. There wasn’t a happy medium with it. Cleaning it wasn’t as quick and easy as I thought it would be either. I would skip this and just use a large round cookie cutter and a for instead from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Saltsman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed by this. We wanted to make our own uncrustables but this did NOT work. You really have to put some muscle into pushing it down all the way (my kids, 11 and 13, could not do it) and once done, the top layer was not secured to the bottom - you could lift it apart easily. Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: kjc_charlotte

customer_reviews.title: handy!
customer_reviews.text: ok.. so i do love this for a few reasons my kids LOVE crustables, but they are expensive to buy all the time. so i thought i would buy this and make our own when they want one and i wont even have to thaw it out. this is is wonderful for the peanut butter jelly ones but if you do lunch meats it wont seal. it does take some practice to get it right but after a few i am now a professional. i would say get you one if your kids eat those type of sandwiches as much as mine do but if not then just buy frozen for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Desaray coplin

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing makes uncrustables like a boss. Well at least until the part you push down on broke. If it was a little sturdier I’d give it 5 stars all day. Unfortunately it did break after about 7 months. But with the number of those my kids eat it was cheaper for me to just buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Halstead

customer_reviews.title: Pie like sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make cute little pie like peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. It kind of worked? It was not sharp enough to cut. It pressed nicely . I guess it would be too dangerous to have it sharper. I used knife to cut around outer edge. It worked. Grand daughter loved it
customer_reviews.author: Barbie doll 7

customer_reviews.title: Make your own sandwiches so easily
customer_reviews.text: Use this all the time now and it works great and is so durable. Easily rinsed or cleaned. We make our own uncrustable sandwiches for lunch with this and it is wonderful! Cuts and crimps. We then bag the sandwiches and use them right away or freeze them. This makes such a great item to gift or have for making lunches for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design, makes it painful and ineffective
customer_reviews.text: When I press down on the top to cut and seal the sandwich, only the tiny piece in the middle has resistance. The bell shaped piece around it moves almost freely, which means you’re trying to push through a sandwich by putting all the pressure on just the tiny middle piece which is not effective and hurts like heck! I’ve been using a cutting board to push in it because it hurts too much to use my hands, but it takes all my weight to even almost get through soft bread, and I still end up tearing the crust off. I am really surprised by this poor design from pampered chef—is mine possibly defective?
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Might get a used one
customer_reviews.text: What I liked was that it was simple to use. No reason anyone would need instructions. You know what you the outcome is supposed to look like. Great tool to add to my breakfast meal. So far I have made about 10 uncrustables. Kids love them and thought they were the store bought. What I hate is it looked used and the stainless looked like it had water stains all over it. Washed it and used it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, not built like they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this round cutter. I had one when I was younger and I loved it. I was incredibly disappointed when the one I ordered arrived broken. They really don't make things very sturdy anymore. The inside was shattered and the frame was bent.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: ROLL YO BREAD FIRST
customer_reviews.text: For the love of all things Uncrustable, please roll your bread out with a dough roller first. It comes with instructions, but lets be real, who reads those? I didn't. And my uncrustables came out like my muffin top comes out my jeans. It was a hot mess. Learn from my mistakes. ROLL YO BREAD.
customer_reviews.author: Adalina

customer_reviews.title: You'll never pay for a box of uncrustables again. Fun to make them too!
customer_reviews.text: Like most pampered chef items, this is built to last. A coworker inspired me when he came In daily with his "uncrustables" PBJ kiddo snack. As a father of 2, I take great joy stamping out a dozen quick and easy sandwiches for the girls. Freeze them easily for a quick meal on the go. Will easily pay for itself! Even tried making my own mini hot pizza pockets.. worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A

customer_reviews.title: Lovely concept despite ripped sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: This makes sandwiches so much easier for our 2-year-old to handle. They tend to rip though, I still haven't made a sandwich that sealed all the way around without creating a tear in the part of the bread where the center is. Great concept and no regrets here, but I probably would research other brands or models if I were to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Dirty
customer_reviews.text: Used and dirty!!! Flimsy product that arrived with a bug in it, fingerprints and dis colored, scratched "stainless steel "
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: For how much I paid for this I expected greater things. I read some reviews and watched some videos on how to use this. I got different kinds of breads (super cheap breads and nicer breads) but neither worked all that great. It tears the bread a lot and sometimes doesn't seal the greatest. We tend to buy the sandwiches at the store instead of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this...I got this to make uncrushables at home and freeze for later. I thought it would be easy. It is not. I feel like a fool for wasting money on this. If you're buying this to make your life easier don't get it. Maybe try one of the plastic sandwich cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlyh

customer_reviews.title: Manual Labor
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well but you really need some muscle to push it. I had bruises in my palm after the first time. Sandwiches are hard to get back out after you press them and it's a pain to clean.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome homemade uncrustables
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I've purchased. I keep giving them away to friends that love it! One thing I do wish it that it were square shaped. I feel the circle wastes a lot of bread and a square would definitely go more edge to edge. It presses, seal and cuts fantastic, though!
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but doesn’t cut all the way through
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use! Much cheaper to make these using this rather than pay for already made frozen uncrustables. My only issue is that it doesn’t cut all the way through. I have to lift up and out my fingers under the bread and run all along the edges to cut it all the way through. But it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea D

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter will not eat the uncrustables bc they only come with jelly. Now I can premake and freeze PB sandwiches for her. Makes my life easier. It takes a few times to get the hang of it, but super easy.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA NC2002

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Got these to save money and not have to buy the premade pbjs. My kids will eat them sometimes but my three year old “wants the one in the bag”. I will probably have to do as others have and get the square bags and put my own labels on them. Figuring out the pbj ratio took a few sandwiches...also wonder bread worked the best as it was more “squishy” than the normal bread I use.
customer_reviews.author: Ambre

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This little kitchen tool is a must have if your child likes Uncrustables. The best part is you can use your favorite ingredients like wheat bread and all natural peanut butter. The options are endless. It cuts the bread nicely but I will say you need to try some different kinds of bread to find the kind that works best.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Sandwich cutter, I say not!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived and was a lot bigger than I expected! When I bought it, I thought I was getting a small cutter for finger sandwiches. Instead I got a huge circle! You could only get one cut per piece of loaf bread. Definitely too big for mini sandwiches!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Q. King

customer_reviews.title: Plastic version wins unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the plastic version is just easier to use. So I would recommend that one over this one. The other one (plastic): -Sandwich pops out easier. -You can throw it in the dishwasher and it cleans all the surfaces The blade is less likely to cut you accidentally (friend cut himself on this one) -Easier to see the action as it does not cover up the sandwich while pressing down, which makes it easier to perfect your filling and pressing technique -Is square or circle. Just circle is classic but square is more practical for a square piece of bread.
customer_reviews.author: C. Diddy

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: It takes a teeny bit to get used to, but I like it a lot. My boys don’t mind crusts, but sometimes we get extra bread and it’s just nice to do this to make pb and j’s ahead and pop them in freezer and then when we are short on time we just grab them for festivals, breakfasts, trips, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: It makes a fun sandwich.
customer_reviews.text: I like it! I did figure out how to make the crimping stay together. I actually cut both pieces of bread first with this tool. I then make the PBJ and make sure I don’t get any too close to the edge. The crimping then holds great!
customer_reviews.author: Bebe Schank

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Made some pretty nice uncrustable dupes for my three year old. She couldn’t tell a difference. Learn from my mistake and slide it down on the sandwich, turn it to cut into a circle and THEN push down on the top to seal the sandwich into a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Richard

customer_reviews.title: don't push too hard
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great for sandwich making. Easy to use, but took a couple exploded sandwiches for me to realize you don't slam it down so hard. Just a gentle firm press down does the trick. Cleaning can be a slight challenge with the moving parts, but not a deal breaker. Kids loved the end product.
customer_reviews.author: Online mogul

customer_reviews.title: Better than Uncrustables
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to buying Uncrustables. I do try to buy smaller bread to minimize waste, though. It's easy to clean, and it holds up great with frequent use. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: B4

customer_reviews.title: Unless
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this! All the bread just got stuck in the top half and I had to scrap it and star all over again
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Word

customer_reviews.title: Good with some tips!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t include instructions but I tried tips from other reviewers. I set a cast iron pan on 2 slices of bread to smoosh it a bit first before putting on pb & j and that made a huge difference. I then used a butter knife to cut away the excess bread before lifting the cutter. My son loved the result!
customer_reviews.author: EJCS

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to everyone with kids
customer_reviews.text: This makes it really easy to make sandwiches for my toddler. She always eats the whole sandwich and there’s less mess. It seems a little stiff or something otherwise I would have gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: J&C

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we like to have a little fun and pack fake Uncrustables to take with us during travel softball season. Use fresh, soft bread, and don't over fill, and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Uncrustables!
customer_reviews.text: Now I can make my kid his beloved uncrustables with organic bread and alternative nut butter so he can actually bring it to school. It’s great! It’s pretty sturdy and well made. Doesn’t feel like it’s going to break. All metal and does screw apart if needed
customer_reviews.author: heather

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this product. I saw it in a video online and purchased it . I used it a couple times and it doesn’t work well. It is difficult to clean and it does not cut the bread very well. I don’t even fill the sandwiches with peanut butter .
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Sheikh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Homemade uncrustables!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son actually asked to get this when he realized how expensive the name brand Uncrustables are. Now every Sunday evening, he uses two loaves of bread, peanut butter and jelly to make a ton of homemade uncrustables that he freezes and has as a snack every afternoon when he returns from cross country practice. And my younger son got creative and makes himself ham and pesto uncrustables! Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for moms!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product!! Makes uncrustables JUST as seen in stores but for a fraction of the price!! With several children and being frequently on the road this little tool has become a life saver. I make several uncrustables the night before a busy day, freeze them and the next morning just toss them in a lunch box and we are set to go! The kids just love them- it’s a real treat!
customer_reviews.author: KDilleshaw

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Bread has to be really soft for this to work. I’ve only had luck with one brand. Bread gets stuck and I have to pull it out with a fork or knife which defeats the purpose. Still giving it 3 stars because I haven’t found anything that works better.
customer_reviews.author: Annamal24

customer_reviews.title: Good for making pierogi
customer_reviews.text: Pampered Chef products are the best. My sister mentioned that, much use, the spring on hers broke. I plan to make pierogi on a regular basis, so I bought two. Seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Johnsz

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as expected
customer_reviews.text: My kid likes regular sandwich and we tried to cut the sandwich with tomatoes and cheese in it and it did not cut :(. Looks like it works only with peanut and butter sandwiches. So, its fail for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jahnavi

customer_reviews.title: Makes the sandwich
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a heavier more well made piece of machinery. It seems cheap but has held up beautifully. Makes sandwiches perfectly every time(unless I am heavy on the PB and J). It kind of sucks to clean when there is too much PB.
customer_reviews.author: LennyMak

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works really well for my homemade uncrustables. I make a large batch and freeze for my kids lunches throughout the week. They did not, however, work well when I used them to make miniature pies. They all exploded. 😬 Still usable but I’d like to see how some of the other products that are similar to this work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Whatever keeps the screw in came loose at some point. Not sure when but found out while i was make my 3 yr old a sandwich with the screw on the sandwich! I don't know where the missing part went but I loved it before that happened!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle W

customer_reviews.title: I like it but I need to practice
customer_reviews.text: This is something that takes practice to get just right. It did not come with any directions and I had a really hard time at first. After googling it I am finally getting sandwiches that are not a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this crust eliminator.. already saving me money since I can make my own sandwiches and not buy the premade ones.. will buy again if ever needed
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: out 4 year old loves it for making sandwiches for her lunch! you can out whatever you want in the bread and you get a awesome pressed sandwich. just make sure you don't overflow the bread!
customer_reviews.author: S.H

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few uses!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to receive this product... my children love uncrustables. However, after only a few uses the top ring portion broke not allowing me to push down and seal the sandwich. I hand washed and air dried after each use. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn R.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts and seals
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it cuts and seals the sandwiches, but I did have an issue with the top popping off. So now to seal the sandwich I have to press on the small rod going down the middle of the sealer, which kind of hurts my palm. But other then that I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel C

customer_reviews.title: pass
customer_reviews.text: it really just ripped the bread and didnt seal well. seems like you need a pouch on top a d a flat piece on bottom and then press, not just two pieces of bread made into a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: NSBShannon

customer_reviews.text: My children are super happy about this cutter!!! It saved me a ton of money since I don’t have to by the sandwiches at the store anymore
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: i love this cut and seal product! I was buying $4 boxes of uncrustables that were a waste a money seeing how it was a little over a $1 for sandwich. The day it came in the mail I made 4 uncrustables for my 14 month-old and stuck them in the freezer for later use. Mom win for sure! It cuts and seals beautifully! I would absolutely recommend this product and I have!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: Okay. Doesn’t really work. Followed instructions. Tried looking up tips and tricks. Works okay. Doesn’t cut clean. Leaves marks on top of bread tried using different types of bread and filling amounts.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality compared to 20 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I have an original pampered chef that is 22 years old and ordered this one for my daughter - it’s either an imitation or quality isn’t the same.
customer_reviews.author: Sm

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews but I had to write one for this. My son loves PBJ sandwiches and uncrustables. I thought I would purchase this and see how it did in copying those. It works perfectly!! I did what other reviewers said and use soft whole grain bread and roll it out using a rolling pin and that has yielded the best result. I can usually get 9 sandwiches out of a loaf of bread that costs a fraction of what a box of uncrustable sandwiches cost using better ingredients. Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Back to school lunch
customer_reviews.text: Bought to make P&J sandwiches for picky eater child to bring to school. Sealed sandwiches better than those plastic alternative but because it’s round, seems to waste more bread also. Child like the sandwich though.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLife

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for make ahead sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: This is such a life saver for packing lunches in the morning and so much cheaper than buying the uncrustables. I followed what other reviewers said about peanut butter on both sides and measuring beforehand. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Magical!
customer_reviews.text: Magical. Saves tons of money if you've kiddos that insist on the 'store-bought' version of what this makes. (uncrustables) -and you can make them out of dang near anything for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Uncrustables made more delicious
customer_reviews.text: My daughter will down an uncrustable in a second. I wanted to try making my own with better peanut butter, bread, and jelly. VOILA! My own uncrustable! Now i just need to speed up how long it takes me to make a sandwich..
customer_reviews.author: Kary

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I can make our own uncrustables sandwiches and save so much money. You do have to press it down with a little muscle and put filling right in the middle and it should turn out beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley&Braden ski

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me money with each press!!! My kids love the circle pb&j’s from the freezer section. It took a couple of tries but now I can make a loaf up and freeze them in ziplock bags for a fraction of what four would front the store cost! We also add variety. Honey instead of jelly. Find the right loaf and they are a breeze to make.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Laskey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Makes perfect uncrustables. Unfortunately, it only lasted a little while until the girls said it wasn't the same and stopped eating the ones I made. Anyway, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rad Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Does not cut the sandwich makes a weird imprint does not deal the sandwich. I wish it worked!!! I was so looking forward to this!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Alldredge

product_meta.title: The Pampered Chef Cut N Seal, Medium, 3-1/2-Inch #1195
product_meta.description: Size:3.5 INPut a new twist on pocket sandwiches and tarts. Hot or cold pocket sandwiches, appetizers, pastries and tarts are made fun and easy with the Cut-N-Seal. Simply place filling between two layers of bread or dough, then cut and seal. 3.5" (9 cm).
feature_bullets: Saves money, no need to buy pre-packaged sandwiches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,735 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
